metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: CSS Layout - Horizontal & Vertical Align
Center elements horizontally and vertically
Center Align Elements
To horizontally center a block element (like <div>), use margin: auto;
content.html: To horizontally center a block element (like <div>), use margin: auto;

content.text: Setting the width of the element will prevent it from stretching out to the edges of its container.
content.html: Setting the width of the element will prevent it from stretching out to the edges of its container.

content.text: The element will then take up the specified width, and the remaining space will be split equally between the two margins:
content.html: The element will then take up the specified width, and the remaining space will be split equally between the two margins:

content.text: This div element is centered.
content.html: This div element is centered.

content.code_html:
.center {
  margin: auto;
  width: 50%;
  border: 3px solid green;
  padding: 10px;
}

content.text: Note: Center aligning has no effect if the width property is not set (or set to 100%).
content.html: Note: Center aligning has no effect if the width property is not set (or set to 100%).

content.text: Center Align Text
To just center the text inside an element, use text-align: center;
content.html: To just center the text inside an element, use text-align: center;

content.text: This text is centered.
content.html: This text is centered.

content.code_html:
.center {
  text-align: center;
  border: 3px solid green;
}

content.text: Tip: For more examples on how to align text, see the CSS Text chapter.
content.html: Tip: For more examples on how to align text, see the CSS Text chapter.

content.text: Center an Image
To center an image, set left and right margin to auto and make it into a block element:
content.html: To center an image, set left and right margin to auto and make it into a block element:

content.code_html:
img {
  display: block;
  margin-left: auto;
  margin-right: auto;
  width: 40%;
}

content.text: Left and Right Align - Using position
One method for aligning elements is to use position: absolute; :
content.html: One method for aligning elements is to use position: absolute;:

content.text: In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.
content.html: In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.

content.code_html:
.right {
  position: absolute;
  right: 0px;
  width: 300px;
  border: 3px solid #73AD21;
  padding: 10px;
}

content.text: Note: Absolute positioned elements are removed from the normal flow, and can overlap elements.
content.html: Note: Absolute positioned elements are removed from the normal flow, and can overlap elements.

content.text: Left and Right Align - Using float
Another method for aligning elements is to use the float property:
content.html: Another method for aligning elements is to use the float property:

content.code_html:
.right {
  float: right;
  width: 300px;
  border: 3px solid #73AD21;
  padding: 10px;
}

content.text: The clearfix Hack
Note: If an element is taller than the element containing it, and it is floated, it will overflow outside of its container. You can use the "clearfix hack" to fix this (see example below).
content.html: Note: If an element is taller than the element containing it, and it is floated, it will overflow outside of its container. You can use the "clearfix hack" to fix this (see example below).

content.text: Without Clearfix
With Clearfix
Then we can add the clearfix hack to the containing element to fix this problem:
content.html: Then we can add the clearfix hack to the containing element to fix this problem:

content.code_html:
.clearfix::after {
  content: "";
  clear: both;
  display: table;
}

content.text: Center Vertically - Using padding
There are many ways to center an element vertically in CSS. A simple solution is to use top and bottom padding :
content.html: There are many ways to center an element vertically in CSS. A simple solution is to use top and bottom padding:

content.text: I am vertically centered.
content.html: I am vertically centered.

content.code_html:
.center {
  padding: 70px 0;
  border: 3px solid green;
}

content.text: To center both vertically and horizontally, use padding and text-align: center :
content.html: To center both vertically and horizontally, use padding and text-align: center:

content.text: I am vertically and horizontally centered.
content.html: I am vertically and horizontally centered.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
padding: 70px 0;  border: 3px solid 
green;  text-align: center;

syntax_highlighting.text:
padding: 70px 0;  border: 3px solid 
green;  text-align: center;

content.code_html:
.center {
  padding: 70px 0;
  border: 3px solid green;
  text-align: center;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
padding: 70px 0;  border: 3px solid 
green;  text-align: center;

content.text: Center Vertically - Using line-height
Another trick is to use the line-height property with a value that is equal to the height property:
content.html: Another trick is to use the line-height property with a value that is equal to the height property:

content.text: I am vertically and horizontally centered.
content.html: I am vertically and horizontally centered.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
.center {  line-height: 200px;  height: 200px;  border: 3px solid green;  text-align: center;}/* If the text has multiple lines, add the 
following: */.center p {  line-height: 1.5;  display: inline-block;  vertical-align: middle;}
line-height: 200px;  height: 200px;  border: 3px solid green;  text-align: center;

/* If the text has multiple lines, add the 
following: */

content.code:
.center {  line-height: 200px;  height: 200px;  border: 3px solid green;  text-align: center;}/* If the text has multiple lines, add the
following: */.center p {  line-height: 1.5;  display: inline-block;  vertical-align: middle;}

syntax_highlighting.text:
.center {  line-height: 200px;  height: 200px;  border: 3px solid green;  text-align: center;}/* If the text has multiple lines, add the 
following: */.center p {  line-height: 1.5;  display: inline-block;  vertical-align: middle;}
line-height: 200px;  height: 200px;  border: 3px solid green;  text-align: center;

/* If the text has multiple lines, add the 
following: */

content.code_html:
.center {
  line-height: 200px;
  height: 200px;
  border: 3px solid green;
  text-align: center;
}

/* If the text has multiple lines, add the following: */
.center p {
  line-height: 1.5;
  display: inline-block;
  vertical-align: middle;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
.center {  line-height: 200px;  height: 200px;  border: 3px solid green;  text-align: center;}/* If the text has multiple lines, add the 
following: */.center p {  line-height: 1.5;  display: inline-block;  vertical-align: middle;}
line-height: 200px;  height: 200px;  border: 3px solid green;  text-align: center;

/* If the text has multiple lines, add the

content.text: Center Vertically - Using position & transform
If padding and line-height are not options, another solution is to use positioning and the transform property:
content.html: If padding and line-height are not options, another solution is to use positioning and the transform property:

content.text: I am vertically and horizontally centered.
content.html: I am vertically and horizontally centered.

syntaxHighlighting.text: height: 200px;  position: relative;  border: 3px solid green;

syntax_highlighting.text: height: 200px;  position: relative;  border: 3px solid green;

content.code_html:
.center {
  height: 200px;
  position: relative;
  border: 3px solid green;
}

.center p {
  margin: 0;
  position: absolute;
  top: 50%;
  left: 50%;
  transform: translate(-50%, -50%);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: height: 200px;  position: relative;  border: 3px solid green;

content.text: Tip: You will learn more about the transform property in our 2D Transforms Chapter .
content.html: Tip: You will learn more about the transform property in our 2D Transforms Chapter.

content.text: Center Vertically - Using Flexbox
You can also use flexbox to center things. Just note that flexbox is not supported in IE10 and earlier versions:
content.html: You can also use flexbox to center things. Just note that flexbox is not supported in IE10 and earlier versions:

content.code_html:
.center {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: center;
  align-items: center;
  height: 200px;
  border: 3px solid green;
}

What CSS property can be used to horizontally center a block element like a <div> ?
